pageTitle: Itinerary for Tuesday, November 15, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Tuesday, November 15, 2016:

Ottawa, Ontario

9:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Cabinet Meeting.

Note for media:

  • Ministers will be available to media in the House of Commons Foyer as of 12:00 p.m.


1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will depart for Havana, Republic of Cuba.

Canada Reception Centre
Hangar 11
190 Convair Private
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 12:15 p.m.


Havana, Republic of Cuba

5:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will arrive at José Martí International Airport and will be greeted by a representative of the Cuban Government, Mr. Patrick Parisot, Ambassador of Canada to the Republic of Cuba, and Mrs. Carmen Altamirano.

José Martí International Airport
Havana, Republic of Cuba

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will lay a wreath at the José Martí Monument. He will be accompanied by Ms. Grégoire Trudeau.

José Martí Monument
Plaza de la Revolución
Havana, Republic of Cuba

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


6:30 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will attend the Official Welcoming Ceremony.

Ceremonial Hall, 1st Floor
Revolution Palace
Havana, Republic of Cuba

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


6:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the President of the Republic of Cuba, Raúl Castro.

Revolution Palace
Havana, Republic of Cuba

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity only


8:15 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will attend a cultural performance at the Basilica de San Francisco de Asis.

Closed to media.

8:30 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will attend an official dinner given by the President of the Republic of Cuba, Raúl Castro.

Closed to media.


PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
